Class RuleEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.RuleEngine

  • public class RuleEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class used to check basic chess rules
    Author:
    Matthew

    • Method Detail

      • validateMove

        public static boolean validateMove(Move move,
                   BoardController boardController,
                   boolean printFlag)
        All-in-one legal move checker. This method calls various checks to ensure
      • No pieces were skipped over illegally
      • The move style fit the piece
      • The move doesn't result in the moving player putting themselves in check
      • The piece doesn't get moved to the same square it came from
      • The piece doesn't capture a piece of it's own color

        • True is returned if all checks find the move to be valid, and false otherwise.

Parameters:
move -
boardController -
Returns:

  • isKingVulnerableOnThisSquare

    public static boolean isKingVulnerableOnThisSquare(BoardController boardController,
                                   java.lang.String color,
                                   Move move,
                                   int newRow,
                                   int newCol)
    Helper method for king castling logic. Simulates the king moving to that square so that the square can be checked for any piece attacking it (the king has to be on the square in question, since a pawn wouldn't be able to move diagonally and attack an empty square). Returns true if king is vulnerable on the square designated by parameters row and col.
    Parameters:
    row -
    col -
    Returns:

  • isAttackedSquare

    public static boolean isAttackedSquare(int row,
                       int col,
                       java.lang.String color)
    Checks to see if any piece of team color can attack the square designated by parameters row and col.
    Returns:

  • validateCheck

    public static boolean validateCheck(Move move,
                    BoardController boardController,
                    boolean printFlag)
    Returns true if Piece piece can check a king on the square designated by row and col. Different from validateMove because it doesn't matter if the move would put the checking player into check. Avoids infinite mutual recursion
    Returns:

  • isUnblocked

    public static boolean isUnblocked(Move move,
                  BoardController boardController)
    Delegates to the appropriate handler to verify the that path of the piece in the move parameter is not blocked. Returns true if path is unobstructed, false otherwise.
    Parameters:
    move -
    boardController -
    Returns:

  • isUnblockedKnightPath

    public static boolean isUnblockedKnightPath(Move move,
                            BoardController boardController)
    Returns true. Knight paths are never blocked
    Parameters:

    boardController -
    Returns:

  • isUnblockedKingPath

    public static boolean isUnblockedKingPath(Move move,
                          BoardController boardController)
    Returns true. The one square movement of a king cannot be blocked, and the error checking for castling handles blocking of that type of movement.
    Parameters:
    move -
    boardController -
    Returns:

  • isNotSelfCheck

    public static boolean isNotSelfCheck(Move move,
                     BoardController boardController)
    Simulates the move in question, and checks to see if the moving player would be in check afterwards. If so, false is returned, true otherwise. The board is reverted to it's position before the simulation afterwards.
    Parameters:
    move -
    boardController -
    Returns:

  • undoChanges

    public static void undoChanges(Piece capturedPiece,
               Move move)
    If parameter capturedPiece is a real piece, it is returned to the board and the piece list in the model. The piece that was moved via parameter move is returned to it's initial square also.
    Parameters:
    capturedPiece -
    move -
